title: Paracelsian Medicine & Chemical Philosophy
description: The revolutionary iatrochemical tradition of Paracelsus and his followers (Van Helmont, Croll), combining alchemy, medicine, and natural philosophy to challenge Galenic medicine.
keyFigures: Paracelsus (1493-1541): Revolutionary physician, rejected Galen, integrated alchemy with medicine
Jan Baptist van Helmont (1579-1644): Gas theory, chemical physiology, vitalist philosophy
Oswald Croll (c.1563-1609): Paracelsian physician, systematizer of iatrochemistry
researchValue: Documents the Paracelsian revolution in medicine and chemistry. Van Helmont's Ortus Medicinae is foundational for modern chemistry (coined 'gas'). Essential for understanding the shift from Galenic to chemical medicine.
